name: Dante's Inferno pt. 2 Quiz | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the beast that was the Guardian of the tripartite zone of "Violence"?
questions.explanation:
Minotaur.

	The 7th Zone and the river Phlegethon are also associated with violence to oneself, to nature and neighbor.

questions.text: What river was patrolled by centaurs, often called the "River of Blood"?
Who was the person that carried Dante across the River of Blood?
questions.explanation:
Nessus.

	Nessus was the person who dropped a poison arrow, made by Heracles, on his toe and accidentally killed himself.

questions.text: The opening lines of Canto 1 reflect the similar feelings expressed of another Biblical figure. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Hezekial.

	"In dimidio dierum meorum vadam ad portas inferi"..."In the midst of my days I shall go to the gates of the nether region".

questions.text: What did the 3 beasts encountered by Dante represent: leopard, she-wolf and the lion ?
questions.explanation:
political factions.

	Modern scholars agree that although these beasts are similar to the 7 deadly sins, Dante was really referring to his political enemies: Florentine enemies, the royal house of France and the Papacy.

questions.text: Acheron was the first of four rivers in Hell. Who was the person who helped Dante across?
Minos was a judge of souls found in the second circle of Hell. His verdict was made - in what unusual manner?
We not only see that Plutus, the God of Wealth, but also Charybdis and Scylla reside in which circle of Hell?
The 8th circle of Hell is composed of 10 rings called Malboge. True or false:  Malboge translates to the "Evil Bogs".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Malboge was the Evil pouches coined by Dante.

questions.text: The circle of Hell represented by Wrath is bound by Phlegyas. What dire deed earned him the title of the most wrathful person in history?
questions.correct: burned down the Oracle of Delphi's temple
